definitions.definition: brave and confident; not afraid to say what you feel or to take risks

examples.text: It was a bold move on their part to open a business in France.
Few people have been bold enough to criticize the manager.
Highlight the important words in bold type.

definitions.definition: that can be easily seen; having a strong clear appearance

examples.text: the bold outline of a mountain against the sky
She paints with bold strokes of the brush.
The furniture was painted in bold, primary colours.
a bold black and yellow sign

definitions.definition: used especially when politely asking a question or making a suggestion which you hope will not offend anyone (although it may criticize them slightly)

examples.text: If I may be so bold as to suggest that he made a mistake in his calculations…

definitions.definition: without showing any respect, shame or fear

examples.text: She marched in here, bold as brass, and demanded a pay rise.

wordOrigin: Old English bald, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch boud and to German bald ‘soon’.
